description: Donald Trump has been making waves over in the States as he battles for the keys to the White House, but it is often his hair which steals the show. But where did he get his inspiration from?
title: Donald Trump's hair-raising doubles from emus to trolls and beavers to bunnies
title_page: Donald Trump's hair-raising doubles from emus to trolls and beavers to bunnies | Daily Mail Online
text:
Donald Trump has been making waves over in the States as he battles for the keys to the White House.
But he is at risk of being upstaged - by his own hair, which is just as flamboyant as the man himself.
But where precisely does he get his inspiration from?
Here, we take a look at some of the possibilities...
We are emused: A new web craze is finding animals who look like Presidential hopeful Donald Trump
It’ll be all bite on the night: On the gruelling Republican campaign trail every day is like Groundhog Day
Funny bunny: A swish with the hairbrush and a long-haired rabbit becomes the perfect Apprentice
Comb-over: The golden pheasant’s plumage is pure Trump and that look in the eye says: You’re fired!
Who looks moth-eaten? The caterpillar of the flannel moth — megalopyge opercularis — is on the right
A-maize-ing: A gust of wind catches The Donald’s hair, turning him into a tasty looking corn on the cob
A peculiar feline: He’s wearing a wig . . . the cat, that is, not the would-be next President of the USA
Toy story: Was the Trump style inspired by one of his children’s Troll Dolls?
Dogged determination: That’s how Trump has taken U.S. politics by storm
Big beast of the jungle: Yes, it’s the Lying King, oops, we mean the Lion King
